original_text:
Maximus Soldier of Rome
La magnificenza dell’Impero Romano è dovuta a innumerevoli fattori, dalle immense strutture architettoniche ancora oggi ammirate in tutto il mondo, come gli acquedotti e le arene, alla loro capacità di creare un modello di democrazia giusto e imparziale. Un altro aspetto di vitale importanza che ha contribuito a renderlo immortale, è l’esercito e le tecniche di guerra, una macchina talmente perfetta da permettere a Roma di conquistare territori in lungo e in largo. È proprio all’esercito romano che si ispira Maximus Soldier of Rome, slot prodotta dall’Inspired. La grafica è abbastanza semplice con tutti gli elementi tipici dell’esercito a romano, come la biga o lo scudo con le doppie spade incrociate. Due antiche colonne delimitano la griglia di gioca e sulla sinistra troviamo tutti le impostazioni per settare al meglio la propria scommessa. Ogni Spin è accompagnato dallo squillo delle trombe e dal suono meccanico dei rulli.
Caratteristiche di Maximus Soldier of Rome
La griglia ha un struttura tradizionale con 5 rulli e 3 righe. Le linee di pagamento sono 20 e fisse, con la puntata minima per linea pari a 0,01 €, quindi 0,20 € per quella totale, caratteristica che la rende appetibile anche per chi non ha voglia di investire grosse cifre. È possibile aumentare la puntata sino a un massimo di 250 €. Le combinazioni vincenti sono formate su rulli adiacenti a partire da sinistra. Maximus Soldier of Rome ha un RTP nella norma, pari al 95%.
Simboli e funzionalità
I simboli K, Q e J sono quelli che pagano meno di tutti, a seguire troviamo l’elmo, la moneta, lo scudo, il Colosseo e infine la biga. Il simbolo che paga di più un assoluto è la scritta “Maximus Soldier of Rome”. Durante il gioco regolare e in modo del tutto casuale si può verificare una modificazione di rulli, introdotta dall’immagine di un centurione che suona la tromba. Esistono 4 tipi di modificatori di rulli:

Reelus Maximus: un simbolo enorme coprirà i rulli 2, 3, 4, trasformando la griglia in una 3×3.
Super Bonus Reels: sui rulli pioveranno numerosi simboli Bonus
Grossa Vincita: in questo caso si ha la certezza di ricevere una vincita altamente remunerativa
5 uguali: sui rulli vedremo comparire almeno una vincita denominata “5 uguali”.

La scritta Wild ha valore di Jolly e sostituisce tutti i simboli eccetto quello Bonus. Se 3 o più simboli Bonus appariranno sui rulli, allora la griglia sarà sostituita da una ruota che ci regalerà un gioco Bonus. Vediamoli nel dettaglio:

Prizes on Parade: Sulla schermata vedremo apparire tre scudi, ognuno contenente un numero di premi, una freccia che permette di passare allo scudo successivo e diversi moltiplicatori chiamati collect che porteranno a terminare il gioco Bonus
Caesars Free Spins: il giocatore avrà davanti due ruote, una che indicherà il numero di giri gratuiti a disposizione, una per selezionare il moltiplicatore valido durante tutti i Free Spins
Road to Rome: il giocatore deve lanciare i dadi e cercare di arrivare a Roma per ricevere una grande vincita
Wild Power Spins: tre giri gratuiti a disposizione, durante i quali il centurione farà cadere dei simboli Wild sui rulli per aumentare le vincite.

raw_translation.response:
Maximus Soldier of Rome
The magnificence of the Roman Empire is due to countless factors, from the immense architectural structures still admired today around the world, such as aqueducts and arenas, to their ability to create a model of fair and impartial democracy. Another vital aspect that contributed to make it immortal is the army and war techniques, a machine so perfect that it allowed Rome to conquer territories far and wide. It is precisely the Roman army that inspired Maximus Soldier of Rome, a slot produced by Inspired. The graphics are quite simple with all the typical elements of the Roman army, such as the chariot or the shield with the double crossed swords. Two ancient columns delimit the playing grid and all the settings to set your best bet can be found on the left. Each spin is accompanied by the sound of trumpets and the mechanical sound of the reels.
Features of Maximus Soldier of Rome
The grid has a traditional structure with 5 reels and 3 rows. There are 20 fixed paylines, with a minimum bet per line of 0.01 €, therefore 0.20 € for the total, a feature that makes it attractive even for those who do not want to invest large amounts. It is possible to increase the bet up to a maximum of 250 €. Winning combinations are formed on adjacent reels starting from the left. Maximus Soldier of Rome has an RTP in line with the norm, equal to 95%.
Symbols and functionalities
The symbols K, Q and J are those that pay the least of all, followed by the helmet, the coin, the shield, the Colosseum and finally the chariot. The symbol that pays the absolute most is the inscription "Maximus Soldier of Rome". During regular play and entirely randomly, a modification of the reels may occur, introduced by the image of a centurion playing a trumpet. There are 4 types of reel modifiers:

Reelus Maximus: a huge symbol will cover reels 2, 3, 4, transforming the grid into a 3×3 one.
Super Bonus Reels: Bonus symbols will rain down on the reels
Big Win: in this case, there is a guarantee of receiving a highly profitable win
5 Equals: on the reels, we will see at least one win called "5 equals".

The Wild inscription has a value of a wild card and replaces all symbols except the Bonus one. If 3 or more Bonus symbols appear on the reels, then the grid will be replaced by a wheel that will give us a Bonus game. Let's see them in detail:

Prizes on Parade: On the screen, we will see three shields, each containing a number of prizes, an arrow that allows us to move to the next shield, and various multipliers called collectors that will lead us to end the Bonus game
Caesars Free Spins: the player has two wheels, one indicating the number of free spins available, one to select the multiplier valid during all Free Spins
Road to Rome: the player must roll the dice and try to get to Rome to receive a big win
Wild Power Spins: three free spins available, during which the centurion will drop Wild symbols on the reels to increase winnings.

Review: Maximus Soldier of Rome
The magnificence of the Roman Empire is due to countless factors, from the immense architectural structures still admired today around the world, such as aqueducts and arenas, to their ability to create a model of fair and impartial democracy. Another vital aspect that contributed to make it immortal is the army and war techniques, a machine so perfect that it allowed Rome to conquer territories far and wide. It is precisely the Roman army that inspired Maximus Soldier of Rome, a slot produced by Inspired. The graphics are quite simple with all the typical elements of the Roman army, such as the chariot or the shield with the double crossed swords. Two ancient columns delimit the playing grid and all the settings to set your best bet can be found on the left. Each spin is accompanied by the sound of trumpets and the mechanical sound of the reels.
Features of Maximus Soldier of Rome
The grid has a traditional structure with 5 reels and 3 rows. There are 20 fixed paylines, with a minimum bet per line of 0.01 €, therefore 0.20 € for the total, a feature that makes it attractive even for those who do not want to invest large amounts. Symbols and functionalities
The symbols K, Q and J are those that pay the least of all, followed by the helmet, the coin, the shield, the Colosseum and finally the chariot. The symbol that pays the absolute most is the inscription "Maximus Soldier of Rome". During regular play and entirely randomly, a modification of the reels may occur, introduced by the image of a centurion playing a trumpet. There are 4 types of reel modifiers:

Reelus Maximus: a huge symbol will cover reels 2, 3, 4, transforming the grid into a 3×3 one.

Prizes on Parade: On the screen, we will see three shields, each containing a number of prizes, an arrow that allows us to move to the next shield, and various multipliers called collectors that will lead us to end the Bonus game
Caesars Free Spins: the player has two wheels, one indicating the number of free spins available, one to select the multiplier valid during all Free Spins
Road to Rome: the player must roll the dice and try to get to Rome to receive a big win
Wild Power Spins: three free spins available, during which the centurion will drop Wild symbols on the reels to increase winnings.

Maximus Soldier of Rome is a slot game that takes inspiration from the Roman army and its glorious conquests. Produced by Inspired, this slot game features simple and traditional graphics with symbols such as the chariot and shield with double crossed swords. The game also features trumpets and mechanical sound of the reels on each spin.

Gameplay features

Maximus Soldier of Rome has a traditional 5 reel and 3 rows structure with 20 fixed paylines. The minimum bet per line is 0.01 € and maximum bet can go up to 250 €. Winning combinations are formed on adjacent reels starting from the left. With an RTP of 95%, it offers a perfect balance of entertainment and profitability. 

Paylines and bets

This slot game offers 20 fixed paylines and a minimum bet per line of 0.01 €. With a maximum bet of 250 € per spin, it is an attractive option for players wanting to invest both small and large amounts.

Bonus games

When 3 or more Bonus symbols appear on the reels, a Bonus game triggers. The slot game offers 4 different types of Bonus games including Prizes on Parade, Caesars Free Spins, Road to Rome and Wild Power Spins. Prizes on Parade offers a screen with three shields, each containing a number of prizes and various multipliers. Caesars Free Spins offer a selection of free spins and multipliers while Road to Rome requires players to roll the dice and reach Rome for a big win. Wild Power Spins offer three free spins and numerous Wild symbols for increased winnings.

Review: Maximus Soldier of Rome
The magnificence of the Roman Empire is due to countless factors, from the immense architectural structures still admired today around the world, such as aqueducts and arenas, to their ability to create a model of fair and impartial democracy. Another vital aspect that contributed to make it immortal is the army and war techniques, a machine so perfect that it allowed Rome to conquer territories far and wide. It is precisely the Roman army that inspired Maximus Soldier of Rome, a slot produced by Inspired. The graphics are quite simple with all the typical elements of the Roman army, such as the chariot or the shield with the double crossed swords. Two ancient columns delimit the playing grid and all the settings to set your best bet can be found on the left. Each spin is accompanied by the sound of trumpets and the mechanical sound of the reels.
Features of Maximus Soldier of Rome
The grid has a traditional structure with 5 reels and 3 rows. There are 20 fixed paylines, with a minimum bet per line of 0.01 €, therefore 0.20 € for the total, a feature that makes it attractive even for those who do not want to invest large amounts. It is possible to increase the bet up to a maximum of 250 €. Winning combinations are formed on adjacent reels starting from the left. Maximus Soldier of Rome has an RTP in line with the norm, equal to 95%.
Symbols and functionalities
The symbols K, Q and J are those that pay the least of all, followed by the helmet, the coin, the shield, the Colosseum and finally the chariot. The symbol that pays the absolute most is the inscription "Maximus Soldier of Rome". During regular play and entirely randomly, a modification of the reels may occur, introduced by the image of a centurion playing a trumpet. There are 4 types of reel modifiers:

Reelus Maximus: a huge symbol will cover reels 2, 3, 4, transforming the grid into a 3×3 one.
Super Bonus Reels: Bonus symbols will rain down on the reels
Big Win: in this case, there is a guarantee of receiving a highly profitable win
5 Equals: on the reels, we will see at least one win called "5 equals".

The Wild inscription has a value of a wild card and replaces all symbols except the Bonus one. If 3 or more Bonus symbols appear on the reels, then the grid will be replaced by a wheel that will give us a Bonus game. Let's see them in detail:

Prizes on Parade: On the screen, we will see three shields, each containing a number of prizes, an arrow that allows us to move to the next shield, and various multipliers called collectors that will lead us to end the Bonus game
Caesars Free Spins: the player has two wheels, one indicating the number of free spins available, one to select the multiplier valid during all Free Spins
Road to Rome: the player must roll the dice and try to get to Rome to receive a big win
Wild Power Spins: three free spins available, during which the centurion will drop Wild symbols on the reels to increase winnings.
